newsitem.title: POLAND: Zloty firms vs basket, market waits for NBP action.
newsitem.headline: Zloty firms vs basket, market waits for NBP action.

text.p: The zloty firmed past resistance levels in early Thursday trade as foreign investors payed for fixed bonds bought at Wednesday's auction, dealers said.
They said that the central bank was likely to step in with a currency-buying intervention to knock the zloty down.

"There is strong currency-selling pressure on the market as foreign clients enter Polish treasuries. The market expects the central bank should intervene to knock the zloty back down," said Jaroslaw Dryjski, dealer at Bank Slaski SA.
At 0930 GMT the zloty was at 2.57/2.54 percent from the parity rate, up from opening's 2.52/2.46 percent.
It was at 3.1535/45 to the dollar, up from 3.1555/75 at opening and at 1.8405/10 to the mark, against 1.8410/20.
Foreign investors bought as estimated $200 million zlotys worth of fixed bonds on Wednesday, but some have already made forex tranactions ahead of the auction, dealers said.

On the money market one-day rates found support around 23 percent as Thursday's net cash inflow was partly offest by the central bank's 250 million zlotys 91-day NBP-bill offer with an overnight value date, dealers said.
Both O/N and tomorrow/next rates were virtually flat around opening levels at 23.00/23.20 percent by mid-morning.
